stream_context.summary: Kaze models & programs the Space-City section of Course 14: adds a gramophone-shaped concert hall, glowing-tile walkway, movie-style spot-lighting and a “space taxi” link while chatting about shaders, PC-port requests and team contributions.

development_findings.summary: Course 14 hub now includes a gramophone-shaped concert hall, reached by a glowing-tile walkway and a planned space-taxi that crosses an otherwise unjumpable gap.
Zeina supplied new concept art for a “mutant Yoshi” boss that will appear in this level.
development_findings.quote: This was her idea for the mutant Yoshi – that’s the boss enemy here.

development_findings.summary: First act design: shy guys hide in their houses; after the boss is beaten they will emerge and drive flying cars, opening fast travel inside the level.
development_findings.quote: During the second act, after you beat the boss, the shy guys are out and they're gonna drive these cars… then you will be able to get around the level.

development_findings.summary: Kaze debugged ‘movie lights’; kept one instance, fixed its matrix and direction so it correctly lights Mario, and plans to sync the light’s intensity with floor pulsation.
development_findings.quote: Alright, there we go, now Mario is being lit up by the light as intended.

development_findings.summary: Reflection wall effect is faked by translating texture coordinates with the Lakitu camera matrix; real reflections are impossible on N64 performance-wise.
development_findings.quote: We obviously do not have the computing power to actually reflect the stars.

development_findings.summary: Shader/engine profiling shows main loop reduced to ~2 ms; Kaze monitors RSP/RDP timings while preparing a 45-minute YouTube deep-dive on Mario 64 shaders.
Kaze rejects adding complex dynamic shadows because consistency would require re-authoring the entire game’s lighting.
development_findings.quote: If I add complex shadows in one place, I need them everywhere and that’s going to be so much work.

development_findings.summary: Kaze is firmly against an official PC port of RTYI, arguing it offers little over RT64 emulator enhancements and he will not maintain it.
development_findings.quote: Personally, I am not doing shit. I have nothing to do with the PC port.

context_findings.summary: Kaze values game flow that is linearly guided yet feels open, calling it ‘key to modern game design’.
context_findings.quote: The gameplay is more linear but the feeling is hopefully not more linear – I think that's key to modern game design.

context_findings.summary: He enjoys mock-criticising media but dislikes collective dog-piling, fearing it feels like bullying.
context_findings.quote: I like hating on things, but I don't like if other people join me… then I feel like a bully.

context_findings.summary: Since 2022 Kaze also works as a full-time professional programmer; ROM-hacking is now effectively a second job.
context_findings.quote: In 2022, I got a job as a programmer as well. So now I also work as a programmer.

context_findings.summary: Financial snapshot: recent YouTube earnings were about $940, of which $500 went to his video editor; Patreon remains the main income source.
context_findings.quote: We made $940; I had to pay my editor like $500… Patreon – that's the majority of my income.

context_findings.summary: Repeated public requests for a PC port frustrate him, yet he recognises individual fans mean no harm.
context_findings.quote: The individual people asking you about it probably don't know that you've already been asked a million times.

context_findings.summary: Believes more funding and staff would improve output, but current low-budget, small-team reality forces optimisation and personal workload.
context_findings.quote: I feel like if I had money to pay people, then I would have a better shot at being a good gamer.

biobak.summary: Polishes Kaze’s raw models, adds ideas, handles UV mapping and combiners; expected to ‘bail out’ the rough flying-car model.
biobak.quote: Biobak goes over my models after I'm done and polishes them up, brings a lot of ideas and new concepts to the table.

badub.summary: Composes the game’s music because Kaze ‘can’t do music at all’.
badub.quote: Yeah Badub is doing the music. I can't do music at all.

zeina.summary: Provides character/creature concept art such as the mutant-Yoshi boss; also sketches for course elements.
zeina.quote: Zeina did some drawing – this was her idea for the mutant Yoshi.

key_stories.title: Fixing the Movie Lights
key_stories.summary: Spotlights in the Space-City hub were mis-oriented and over-numerous. Kaze stripped back to one light, debugged its matrix and direction and linked it to floor illumination.
key_stories.challenge: Lights pointed the wrong way and cluttered the scene.
key_stories.process: Removed extras, printed debug values, inverted direction, tested in-game.
key_stories.outcome: Single spotlight now correctly illuminates Mario; plan to sync brightness with pulsating floor.
key_stories.key_quote: Now Mario is being lit up by the light as intended.

key_stories.title: Designing the Gramophone Concert Hall
key_stories.summary: Kaze wants a concert hall shaped like a gramophone as a key landmark in Space-City. He rough-models the shell and asks Biobak to refine it.
key_stories.challenge: Create a visually striking building that matches the space aesthetic within N64 poly limits.
key_stories.process: Sketched block-out, experimented with subdivisions and reflective wall textures.
key_stories.outcome: Rough geometry in place; awaits Biobak’s polish and interior planning.
key_stories.key_quote: Now for the concert hall building – the idea was that we'd have this path here that goes to the edge of the world.

key_stories.title: Flying Car for Shy Guys
key_stories.summary: Transportation in Course 14 relies on hover-cars driven by shy guys after the boss is beaten. Kaze prototypes the model, optimises triangles and sets up seat textures.
key_stories.challenge: Create a low-poly, space-age vehicle that fits within performance budgets.
key_stories.process: Simplified geometries, added grille and decals, placed placeholder textures.
key_stories.outcome: Working prototype ready; Biobak will refine; AI scripting planned.
key_stories.key_quote: I think this kind of works for the flying cars… there will be a Shy Guy inside here.
